Class FitnessTracker

java.lang.Object
FitnessTracker
public class FitnessTracker extends Object
FitnessTracker.java Author: Chris Silva Class: COP-2800 Assignment: Module 4 - Fitness Tracker Description: This program represents a Fitness tracker which monitors steps, distance walked, calories burned and heart rate. It provides methods to track progress, reset daily statistics and check if goals have been met.

  • Constructor Details

    • FitnessTracker

      public FitnessTracker()
      Explicit default constructor that sets all values within FitnessTracker to zero Initializes name as an empty string and all numeric fields to zero

    • FitnessTracker

      public FitnessTracker(String name, int dailySteps, double distanceWalked, double calsBurned, int heartRate)
      Parameterized constructor that accepts values for all fields Initializes values for all parameters
      Parameters:
      name - the user's name
      dailySteps - the initial step count
      distanceWalked - the initial distance walked in kilometers
      calsBurned - the initial calories burned
      heartRate - the initial heart rate

    • calculateCalories

      public double calculateCalories()
      Calculates calories burned based off the cal/step constant
      Returns:
      the calculated calories burned

    • updateHeartRate

      public void updateHeartRate(int newHeartRate)
      Updates current heart rate
      Parameters:
      newHeartRate - the new heart rate value in bpm (beats per minute)

    • resetDailyStats

      public void resetDailyStats()
      Resets dailySteps, distanceWalked, caloriesBurned to zero

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a summary of a user's daily fitness-related stats
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a formatting String with name, steps taken, distance walked, calories burned and current heart rate

    • setGoalSteps

      public void setGoalSteps(int goalSteps)
      Sets a goal for a number of steps
      Parameters:
      goalSteps - the target number of steps set for each user

    • checkGoal

      public void checkGoal()
      Checks if a user's daily step goal has been met Prints a congratulatory message if the current steps walked are greater than the goal. Prints the number of remaining steps if goal is not yet met
